Ranveer Singh Gets Emotional As He Talks About The Criticism He Receives For His Enthusiasm
Ranveer Singh Gets Emotional As He Talks About The Criticism He Receives For His Enthusiasm
Ranveer Singh isn't just an actor. He is a force. A brand in himself. He can convince you as Khilji, Simmba and now, with Gully Boy, he has just established yet another benchmark for himself as an actor. Currently, there is a lot going on for Singh as an actor.
Agencies
He is busy promoting Gully Boy and also gearing up for Kabir Khan’s ’83, in which he will be seen playing Indian skipper Kapil Dev.
(Also read: From Skirts To Street-Style, Ranveer Singh Couldn't Care Any Less About The Fashion Police!)
Agencies
In a recent interview with BBC Asian Network, Ranveer Singh was asked how he maintains a healthy work-life balance. To which he said, “It’s difficult. It’s not easy."
In a first, he also addressed the criticism that comes his way for being too 'enthusiastic'. He said,
Agencies

“It’s particularly difficult when you get brickbats for just giving. People saying that it’s too much, ‘Why don’t you just curb your enthusiasm.’ It hurts. But it’s okay. People have their own way of perceiving. Every person is wired differently and has their own life experiences that predispose them to perceive certain things in a certain way.”
However, he admitted that there is a certain part of him that he wishes to ‘conserve.’ He adds,
Agencies
“But yes, there is one part of me that wants to conserve. But I am not the kind of person that can hold back. I am just a giver.”
Also starring Alia Bhatt, the film helmed by Zoya Akhtar has hits the screens today.
(Also read: Ranveer Singh Recalls The Fear Of Not Making It Big In Bollywood Because Of No 'Filmy Connections')
